bug.short_desc: Mumble on Fedora 25 Mutes Amarok and VLC automatically
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
While Mumble is opened, Amarok and VLC mute themselves automatically. If Mumble is not running and one of these applications is playing audio, just opening Mumble will cause these players to mute right away and stay muted until I either unmute them or exit Mumble.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
1.2.18
How reproducible:
All the time.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Play audio in VLC or Amarok 2. Open Mumble
Actual results:
VLC and Amarok will mute themselves automatically
Expected results:
For nothing to automatically mute itself indefinitely
Additional info:
It took me a while to realize what was happening and rdieter suggested a quick workaround would be
1. edit /etc/pulse/default.pa 2. comment out load-module module-role-cork 3. pulseaudio -k 4. report the bug
So far the workaround is perfect and possibly even preferred because without any indication of why the auto-muting was happening, experiencing it feels like a major problem.
mumble-1.2.19-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-4213157afa
mumble-1.2.19-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-ca4a8739cd
mumble-1.2.19-1.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-fc7a32f7d2

mumble-1.2.19-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates.
